file_content.text: She died in my arms. You should've seen what those filth did to her.
I'm sorry, Saylew. We all share your loss.
For every one of us the Flesh Raiders butcher, we should kill ten! No, a hundred!
Will that restore your loved one to life?
Don't lecture me, Jedi. My wife is dead! Our people, slaughtered! Where were you then?
Nothing I say will make you feel whole again, but we truly are doing everything we can.
I'm sorry for your loss.
What about exterminating those animals?
Saylew, this Jedi brought us the Flesh Raiders' weapons so we can defend our homes.
I sabotaged the Flesh Raiders' weapons. They'll pay for what they've done.
Crippling the enemy.
Sabotage? It's not enough. It'll never be enough.
I took all the Flesh Raiders' weapons, so you can defend yourselves.
Getting you weapons.
Finally, one of you who understands.
Shut your mouth.
You have an obligation to defend life--to stop evil. Isn't that what you people do?
The Flesh Raiders won't stop until we're all dead. Are you going to let that happen?
I won't quit until the Flesh Raiders are defeated. That's a promise.
Never.
We'll see what a Jedi's promise is worth.
I hope you can fulfill that pledge. I fear he won't take disappointment well.
Perhaps your people would be safer if you left Tython.
You can always leave.
This is our home. No Flesh Raider--or Jedi--will drive us out.
You made a good point. Shame he's too stubborn to hear it.
If you're dumb enough to pick fights with Jedi, maybe you don't deserve to survive.
Maybe I should.
I knew you weren't here to help. We'll just have to take justice for ourselves.
Emotions are running high enough. All you did was stir things up.
Saylew, this Jedi risked everything to seize the Flesh Raiders' own weapons and bring them here.
Give me those weapons. We'll hunt down the Flesh Raiders. We'll have retribution.
You're upset--the last thing you need is a blaster. Let me handle the Flesh Raiders.
You'll die chasing revenge.
This Jedi is wise. Listen to her counsel.
Your wife wouldn't want you to die for revenge. I promise we'll stop these attacks.
Well done, Padawan. He may not feel better, but at least he'll stay out of trouble.
Your leader should decide how to use these weapons--not you.
Ranna's in charge here.
The Jedi is wise. You should listen to her.
Go and mourn your wife, Saylew. I'll organize a militia to protect our village.
He still wants revenge, but at least he isn't armed.
The weapons are yours. I hope you find your enemies.
Take them. [Give weapons]
I will. And they're going to pay.
Emotions and weapons--never a good mix.
Poor Saylew. I understand his grief more than he knows.
People wonder why Jedi are forbidden to marry or have families. They don't see how attachments always lead to suffering.
Passionate emotions can destroy a person--and Jedi destroyed by passion become something terrible.
T7 = salutes Master Orgus // T7 reconnaissance report = ready for delivery
Teeseven was captured by the Flesh Raiders. You'll want to see the holorecording he made.
I found this droid, Master.
This droid says he works for the Jedi. Is that true?
Do you know T7?
Yes, he's one of our long-range probes. We sent out twenty. This is the only one to come back.
This thing's been a pain in my neck since the Flesh Raider camp.
He's all yours.
One of our long-range probes--I thought we'd lost all of them.
T7's holorecording = enemies of Jedi // T7 = play back for Master Orgus
While I deal with the droid, talk to Ranna. I think her people are ready to help us, thanks to you.
What, another outsider who's come to mock us?
